result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Andrew Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Andrew Moore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Andrew Moore was found guilty of 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Michael Andrew Moore was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count 2, with credit for 181 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.
- Not to be present in any vehicle where any firearms are knowingly present.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Referral to/ Mental health evaluation and any recommended mental health treatment.

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Referral to/ Mental health evaluation and any recommended mental health treatment.

supervisions.notes: - Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of extended supervision, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AS TO COUNT 2 ONLY.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Correction entry for 8-9-2022. Defendant plead guilty to counts 1 and 2.
Case referred back to Court. (RESOLVED)

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Michael Andrew Moore.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing. Defendant withdraws motion to withdraw counsel. Sentencing proceeded. Statements as to sentencing. Additional Statement by M. M.
*
AS NTO COUNT 1:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 10 YEARS, consecutive TO COUNT 2, with credit for 181 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 5 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 
*
AS NTO COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS, consecutive TO COUNT 1. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Defendant NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program AS TO COUNT 2 ONLY.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Referral to/ Mental health evaluation and any recommended mental health treatment. 
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to be present in any vehicle where any firearms are knowingly present.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of extended supervision, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Letter from Anita C.  Received and Filed.  nk
Defendant's Motion for Withdrawal of Counsel.  (Michael A. Moore - #2022004702, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of victim notification.

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. Amended Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT *.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count * DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussions held regarding various issues. Court advises will adjourned until tomorrow and that decision will have to be made regarding deal will no longer give additional time. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Michael Andrew Moore not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties advised prepared for trial. Case passed for other jury
Proposed order to allow defendant to review electronic discovery.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Michael Andrew Moore not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pretrial held. Parties remain in trial posture. States offer has been rejected. Defense previously filed motion to modify bail. For reasons stated on the record, court DENIES motion of defense. Jury trial remains set for 8/8/22 at 8:30 am.  Case is adjourned to Br. 4, in person.

EXPIRES 9-12-2022

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Michael Andrew Moore not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.   Defense requests bail hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEARED BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Donahue. Court took Judical Notice 15CF4893. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Per Chief Judge Directive 21-13, this case has been transferred from Judge David Feiss, Branch 46 to Judge Michael Hanrahan, Branch 04.
Information provided to the parties via email.

04:19 PM Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy; both appear by video.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Michael Andrew Moore in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Andrew Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.  Defense motion to dismiss COUNTS 1, 4, 5, 6 and 7.  Arguments heard.
AS TO COUNT 1 in its entirety:  Court DENIED motion to dismiss; COUNT 4, 5, 6:  Court GRANTS dismissal of enhancers only; COUNT 7:  Court GRANTS motion to dismiss charge.
 Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
